barplot:
// A plot with three bars with black borders at "A", "B", and "C". The first bar is red and is the shortest, the second bar is blue and is the tallest, while the third bar is green and its height is in between.
<BarPlot ylim={[0, 10]} yticks={6} title="Example BarPlot" xlabel="Category" ylabel="Value" bar-rounded bar-border={0} margin={0.25}>
  <Bar label="A" size={3} fill={red} />
  <Bar label="B" size={8.5} fill={blue} />
  <Bar label="C" size={6.5} fill={green} />
</BarPlot>
box:
// the text "hello!" in a frame with a dashed border and rounded corners
<Frame padding rounded border-stroke-dasharray={5}>
  <Text>hello!</Text>
</Frame>
datapath:
// plot two lines: (1) a sine wave in red; (2) the same sine wave with a lower amplitude higher frequency sine wave added on top (in blue)
<Plot xlim={[0, 2*pi]} ylim={[-1.5, 1.5]} aspect={phi} margin={0.2} grid>
  <DataPath fy={sin} stroke={red} stroke_width={2} />
  <DataPath fy={x => sin(x) + 0.2*sin(5*x)} stroke={blue} stroke_width={2} />
</Plot>
edge:
// A curved line going from the upper left to the lower right. The left side of the line has a red arrow facing left and the right side has a blue arrow facing right. Both arrows are triangular with black borders.
<Network edge-arrow edge-arrow-base>
  <Node label="hello" pos={[0.2, 0.2]} fill>Hello</Node>
  <Node label="world" pos={[0.8, 0.8]} fill>World!</Node>
  <Edge node1={"hello"} node2={"world"} arrow-beg-fill={red} arrow-end-fill={blue} />
</Network>
ellipse:
// two ellipses, one wider and one taller
<Group>
  <Ellipse pos={[0.3, 0.2]} rad={[0.2, 0.1]} />
  <Ellipse pos={[0.6, 0.6]} rad={[0.2, 0.25]} />
</Group>
grid:
// draw a grid of square boxes filled in light gray. each box contains an arrow that is pointing in a particular direction. that direction rotates clockwise as we move through the grid.
<Frame padding rounded>
  <Grid rows={3} spacing>
    { linspace(0, 360, 10).slice(0, 9).map(th =>
      <Frame padding rounded fill>
        <Group aspect={1} spin={th}>
          <Arrow direc={0} tail={1} pos={[1, 0.5]} rad={0.5} />
        </Group>
      </Frame>
    ) }
  </Grid>
</Frame>
group:
// a square in the top left and a circle in the bottom right
<Group>
  <Rect pos={[0.3, 0.3]} rad={0.1} spin={15} />
  <Ellipse pos={[0.7, 0.7]} rad={0.1} />
</Group>
gum:
// The text "GUM" in a simple frame
<Frame padding margin border rounded>
  <Text>GUM</Text>
</Frame>
latex:
// There are two latex equations framed by rounded borders arranged vertically. The top one shows a Gaussian integral and the bottom one shows a trigonometric identity. They are framed by a square with the title "Facts".
<VStack spacing>
  <Frame padding rounded><Latex rounded>{"\\int_0^{\\infty} \\exp(-x^2) dx = \\sqrt{\\pi}"}</Latex></Frame>
  <Frame padding rounded><Latex rounded>{"\\sin^2(\\theta) + \\cos^2(\\theta) = 1"}</Latex></Frame>
</VStack>
line:
// draw a line from the top left to the bottom right of the frame
<Frame>
  <Line pos1={[0, 0]} pos2={[1, 1]} />
</Frame>
math:
// plot the exponential of sin(x) over [0, 2œÄ]
<Frame margin={0.15}>
  <Plot aspect={phi} ylim={[0, 3]}>
    <DataPath fy={x => exp(sin(x))} xlim={[0, 2*pi]} />
  </Plot>
</Frame>
network:
// A network with a node on the left saying "hello world" and two nodes on the right saying "hello" and "world". There are arrows going from the left node to each of the right nodes. The nodes have gray backgrounds and rounded corners.
<Network coord={[0, 0, 2, 1]} aspect={phi}>
  <Node label="hello world" pos={[0.4, 0.5]} rad={0.2} fill>{["Hello", "world!"]}</Node>
  <Node label="hello" pos={[1.4, 0.25]} rad={0.15} fill>Hello</Node>
  <Node label="world" pos={[1.6, 0.75]} rad={0.15} fill>World!</Node>
  <Edge node1={"hello world"} node2={"hello"} dir1="n" arrow-size={0.07} />
  <Edge node1={"hello world"} node2={"world"} dir1="s" arrow-size={0.07} />
</Network>
node:
// Two boxes with text in them that have black borders and gray interiors. The box in the upper left says "hello" and the box in the lower right says "world!".
<Network node-fill>
  <Node label="hello" pos={[0.2, 0.2]}>Hello</Node>
  <Node label="world" pos={[0.8, 0.8]}>World!</Node>
  <Edge node1={"hello"} node2={"world"} />
</Network>
polyline:
// a square in the center of the figure that is missing its top side
<Polyline>{[
  [0.3, 0.3],
  [0.3, 0.7],
  [0.7, 0.7],
  [0.7, 0.3],
]}</Polyline>
rect:
// a rectangle on the left side of the figure with an aspect of roughly 1/2
<Frame>
  <Rect pos={[0.25, 0.5]} rad={[0.1, 0.2]}/>
</Frame>
stack:
// one large donut in a frame stacked on top of two smaller side-by-side framed donuts
const Donut = () => <Frame><Emoji>üç©</Emoji></Frame>
return <VStack>
  <Donut/>
  <HStack>
    <Donut/>
    <Donut/>
  </HStack>
</VStack>
text:
// The text "Hello World!" / "Multiline text is supported." in a rounded frame
<TextFrame rounded>
  Hello World!
  Multiline text is supported.
</TextFrame>
textbox:
// draw the word "hello" in a rounded rectangular frame
<TextBox border rounded margin>hello</TextBox>
triangle:
// make a diamond shape with two triangles, the triangle on top is red and the triangle on the bottom is blue
<Frame margin rounded padding fill>
  <VStack>
    <Triangle fill={red} aspect={1} stroke-width={0} />
    <Triangle fill={blue} aspect={1} stroke-width={0} vflip />
  </VStack>
</Frame>
unitline:
// draw a plus symbol in a frame and place it in the bottom left corner
<Group pos={[0.3, 0.7]} rad={0.2}>
  <VLine />
  <HLine />
</Group>
